captions.text:
Hope has the power to fill
our lives with happiness.

Hope sustains us through
despair.

We learn to cultivate hope the
same way we learn to walk, one
step at a time.

We grow in our ability to
"abound in hope, through the

power of the Holy Ghost,"
as we more
perfectly live the gospel.

We hope in Jesus Christ, in the
goodness of God, in the

manifestations of the Holy
Spirit, in the knowledge that

prayers are heard
and answered.

Hope teaches that there is
reason to rejoice even when

all seems dark around us, no
matter how bleak the chapter
of our lives may look today.

Because of the life and
sacrifice of Jesus Christ, we

may hope and be assured that the
ending of the book of our

lives will exceed our grandest
expectations.

And to all who suffer--to all
who feel discouraged, worried,

or lonely--I say with love
and deep concern for
you, never give in.
Never surrender.

Never allow despair to overcome
your spirit, for the

love of the Son of God pierces
all darkness, softens all

sorrow, and gladdens
every heart.

Of this I testify and leave you
my blessing in the name of
Jesus Christ, amen.

comments.text: The God of Hope Changes everything '﻿
comments.author: Walterio Hernandez

comments.text: thank you for this x﻿
comments.author: temah M

comments.text:
What if the dark circumstances of your life have lasted for so long, that 
it has caused you to lose all Hope for anything ever getting better; and 
you just simply gave up?﻿
comments.author: CWShier45

comments.text:
+Skeeter62889 To add a little to your thought, I think that life does 
actually give us more than we can handle sometimes, especially if we try to 
do it on our own.  But, if we turn to the Savior, He will carry the burden 
and will offer us the strength that we need to overcome and to carry on.  
That's when the growth comes.
comments.author: Shane Johanson

comments.text:
I think that we all feel like giving up at certain times in life.  
Sometimes hope for anything better can seem more than we can even handle.  
Life is hard and there is much that seems unfair and unjust.  I 
remember time in my life when I knew that everything would only get worse 
before it ever got better.  And yet, I realized that even in that feeling 
there was still a sense of hope.  Even if you feel like you have given up 
and life will never have hope again, it is still there.  Christ is eternal 
and He has felt all of our pains and sorrows and disappointments.  His 
arms remain outstretched to comfort and heal us, no matter how hard the 
road may be.  It is never too late to reach out to Him, even if you feel 
like you have given up.  He will provide peace and comfort, even in the 
hardest and ugliest and most hopeless circumstances.  It doesn't come all 
at once, but it does come.
comments.author: Shane Johanson

comments.text:
I firmly believe the Lord never gives us more than we can handle. He has 
not set us up to fail. If we are living righteously, then welcome 
afflictions, for it is our time to grow the most.
comments.author: Skeeter62889

guidance.

comments.text:
One of the biggest challenges I've faced is brain chemistry stuff , where 
you have to endure sorrow and worry (ie: "depression") just because your 
brain happens to be wired that way. It's been really hard sometimes. I 
totally agree with what was said in this video: "The love of the Son of God 
pierces all darkness, softens all sorrow, and gladdens every heart." Even 
on days when it feels especially dark, I still know in my mind that he's 
there. He always gets me through.

comments.text:
Hope and faith are not the same. Hope is a word that you wish something 
would come true. Its like when you write a check, you hope the money is in 
there. Faith is knowing the money is there. I hope for the day of the 
rapture will be today, faith is knowing I will be in the clouds of that 
wonderful day. Faith is the only thing that will get you to heaven, not 
Hope. Don't preach on hope, because hope is the lack of faith. My hope is 
that all of you are saved. God bless you all.
comments.author: Gene D

as spirit children before we were born & when we die we can return to live

forgiveness, joy, being w/ loved ones, etc.
